storyInfo: Hoederer, Ines and W intercept the Lich Ermengarde, but all four find themselves sucked into a bizarre mirage, one which offers them a view of a fragment of Sarkaz history from seven thousand years ago.

attributes.text: Honestly, since coming to Victoria, my drafting work has been at a standstill.
Back in my mercenary days, I spent most of my free time writing them. One book filled, a new book empty. Really, I had more to write than I physically could.
And yet, since joining the Military Commission, I haven't given those notebooks a flip-through in forever by now.
\nI obtained what seemed like a higher position and power. I wasn't directing a squad or two of mercenaries any longer; now they put the sand table of the whole battlefield before me.
And I grew more and more sick of what I'd written about.
\nI used to believe the most important test of an archivist's character was loyalty to their accounts.
Yet bit by bit, I came to discover these books had turned into echoes of wave after indistinguishable wave, reproductions of scene after scene of the same tragedy.
\nI'd been through this all with my own flesh, felt it all with my own soul. Why even make all this... vacant language and empty summary out of it?
I'd had enough.
When did it happen, again?
\nI remember. Last year in September... last year, where the summer was exceptionally long.

attributes.content: General, the Mayor is dead.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Your saber still drips with the blood.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: If only the blades of the Military Commission and the mercenaries could be as swift.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: As long as it's a weapon, there's no real difference.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: I remember the look he gave me in that moment.
\nBut I'm still not sure what he really meant by it.

attributes.content: ...Roger.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: News just came from the mercs. The fourteen MPs in the plot to assassinate the Regent have been apprehended.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And what stance are the other MPs taking?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: They don't have one.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I thought you'd be more direct about your methods.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: If the Military Commission requires, I can execute every MP straight away.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: With our current situation, this will suffice. The airship is still under construction; we need just a little extra patience.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Pull your men out. The Nachzehrer King's legion has arrived.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...Legion?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: My voice shakes a little. The Nachzehrer's legion.
\nOf all the 'military powers' I'd met in war, the vast majority paled compared to that one name. The difference was heaven and earth.

attributes.content: When? How?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Whatever direction a Kazdel army enters Victoria from, they'd have to pass through major duchies. It wouldn't matter how they conceal themselves, that large a force could neverâ€”
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: His Majesty has arrived at Londinium's suburbs. Two reorganized Royal Court units directly subordinate to him have been stationed outside the city.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I understand. I'll order the mercs to withdraw.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: That Lt. Colonel Lettou had his talk with the Regent. He and his Defense Forces will soon be assuming control over all of Londinium's administrative affairs.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: On the surface, Londinium will enter a state of semi-martial control led by the Defense Forces, owing to the 'garrisoned rebellion'.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Don't think that'll fool the Grand Dukes... their intelligence networks are well developed in the city. They'll definitely start mobilizing for war within the next few months.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It won't take that long. It's exceedingly likely the quickest army will show up beneath Londinium's walls within twenty days.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: But no fear. No matter who arrives first, they won't be hasty to act.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Any duke that dares march alone will become the common enemy of all, just as in the Duke of Windermere's failure of a raid two years ago.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Her high-speed warships didn't even succeed in launching from their berths before her own men obstructed her. It was ridiculous.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The Duke of Windermere... She's clever. She's been warning Parliament since the day the Regent first made contact with Victoria.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Cavendish didn't just invite us to enter Londinium on his lonesome. Each and every duke was hoping to make a 'military vassal' out of the Regent, an assistant to the thorns in their sides.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Understand? This Duke of Windermere is no exception. Behind the guise of the iron-fisted soldier, she obeys the game logic of aristocrats as much as the rest.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: She was just the one most impatient to place us back in the toolbox.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: From what I hear, Victoria's legendary Steam Knights don't exist anymore.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You do have a nose for sniffing, Hoederer. Not a good quality for a serviceman.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I'm a mercenary, General.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The Regent and Military Commission's scheme was a huge success. Pretty crazy. Somehow, the Sarkaz have a firm hold on Victoria's capital.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The dukes need an easy-to-cut-up army to put down dissidents, and Parliament is desperate for an 'appropriate' defense, to avoid any more action like those two stupid dukes' adventures.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: In their eyes, the Sarkaz came fresh out of civil war on a silver platter, table ready, disposable.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Now, we've taken the industrial sector, leashed Parliament, and even The Shard will be under our control any day now. The Regent's taken Londinium, for real.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But we can't shunt this city off.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We can stir up conflict, but then what? We end up buried together with Londinium under a coalition of foreign militaries?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What is the Commission planning?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: I know I'm being a little too forward. But you draw suspicion by being too obedient.
Yet Manfred doesn't even turn to look at me. He's... flipping through a book.
\nUntitled.

attributes.content: Do mercenaries have so many problems, Hoederer? Have I given you too much leeway?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I only need to know what the goal I'm serving is.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The mercenaries I know have other tastes. Inquiring as to the more loose-pocketed employer, or mulling over how to waylay a Sankta caravan.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...I just have different personal habits.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: 'Personal habits'.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.text: The Military Commission general before me pries his gaze away from the book. I hear his position here isn't just for his service rank; I hear his relationship with Theresis is very special.
\nWhich means, I have to be extra cautious.
I dip my head slightly, working to ensure I express enough respect and humility.

attributes.content: Is your eye alright?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...It affects my depth perception in sword combat. I'll get used to it ASAP.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I received your interrogation records. The assassin was an Ines woman, a mercenary alike.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We sure didn't expect a Sarkaz like Ines to get bought out by Parliament, especially for a hit on the Regent.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Ines is dead, and you lost an eye for it. You'll receive commendations from the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No commendations necessary.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Then you'll receive payment, in mercenary fashion.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: After all, you and Ines, and that lunatic with the W callsign, led an active mercenary unit for quite some time. The old Sarkaz of the Scar Market, their commendations for you are blinding.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Very decisive of you to kill her.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: It's the only way a mercenary lives. We'll do anything to survive.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Even gutting your own colleagues?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Even gutting our own colleagues.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Then I'm sure one day you'll come to dispatch me. Won't you?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You asked me just now. What could the Military Commission be planning?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Our plan is only drawn up to the point war breaks out. As for what follows, that would be... their plan to make.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: This place is the heart of hatred, and it will be buried by vengeance.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Just as you wrote in those booklets. Just as every war we've been through.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: So you were...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Never mind that. Carry on writing.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You've a heavy mission. Bear that responsibility.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.text: Now, the Military Commission's duty in Londinium is fulfilled. With a single activation of The Shard, the tempest of war will be unstoppable.
\nIn which case, what more could Theresis want to do?
\nWhat more can we do?

attributes.content: Done with your notes?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No, I wasn't writing anything.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Just giving this sword another polish. The mercenary claymore... I haven't used this thing in forever.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You're so heartless.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: If you want it, you can have it. A present from me to you.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: A sword? Low efficiency, zero interest.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: *sigh*... And you found the time to fix your hair?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Can't blame you, I guess. We're not going to have the time for hair gel like you did back in Londinium.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's just more convenient this way.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You should've kept that outfit. Maybe you could keep acting the merc leader, treasure of the army?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What's that thing army guys say? It's your calling to serve?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: A mercenary's calling is to get paid, not get bereavement. Knock it off and save your spittle, you two.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Defense perimeter, scouting radius. Is this the opening?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Until they started fighting, yeah.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: As for now... they're marching. No matter how much the dukes hate each other's guts, this front's gonna close in sooner or later.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You're sure your guy's gonna pass this position? You can literally see The Shard's Catastrophe clouds from here.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The Catastrophe's landing point is the line of fire between the Duke of Wellington and the Nachzehrer King. Chances are the Iron Duke will retreat his front.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: As for Windermere, she probably won't have the spare energy to deploy her own forces until she gets her daughter back inside a nomadic fortress.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: My 'guy' doesn't have a lot of exit routes from Londinium.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Wait. Incoming.
attributes.name: Ines
Ines
attributes.content: The shadow's very fast. It's like...

attributes.name: Ines
attributes.content: Er, a polygonal... yarn ball?
A what?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The overall shape is polygonal, but highly irregular.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's Arts. High chance the naked eye can't follow it, or else she wouldn't make it here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Target confirmed. We can only afford a little rough play.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Wâ€”
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: I turn back, and she's gone.
\nA second later, deafening explosions.

attributes.content: *sigh*... After her!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: The scale of the dust cloaks the entire surroundings, but we're not blind to what's either a sizable witchcraft vehicle or a bizarre aircraft.
\nAs ever, W kicks off without restraint. If we did graze a Lich...
I brush away the smoke, but surprisingly, I feel myself hit something.
\nWhat is that? A wire?
Silk threads. Hanging crisscrossing from the void, then pressing into it again.

attributes.content: ...Mercenaries?
What a coincidence. Come at me, then.
This is where the strange sensations truly start.

attributes.text: Her figure snaps into formlessness in an instant, threads swirling and fading. I thrust an arm out with all my strength, but grab at nothing but dust.

attributes.content: Did she run? I told you, you can't blow a Lich up with bombs.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No. She's still around.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We have to catch her.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Something's not quite right. We never passed by any area like this.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Nothing here casts any shadow. Is it an illusion?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I think there's a bunch of big guys over there, right by the mountain.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Those are some crazy swords. How do they lift 'em?
attributes.name: W

attributes.text: Mountain?
\nWasn't this a plain?
I follow where W's looking. The haze gradually thins, and the scene becomes clear.
\nI gulp.
\nPractically everything about the battlefield leaves my mind.

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) The ash-bleached city lies ahead. Let us hasten.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) It will admit us. The children of the soil and stone have built city walls on Sorrow's Ground.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) Kazdel. Each syllable is a bitter journey unto its own.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) Where is it? From dreams we have departed, seeking to this day.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) The age of exile has come to an endâ€”
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.content: What are they saying?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It's an ancient Sarkaz dialect.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: 'Sorrow's ground'. 'Ash-bleached city'. I'm having trouble with the restâ€”I can only guess.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I think they mentioned Kazdel too? Which one?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) DiÎ±blo Balor'saÄa of the Condemnor Clan and Qui'lon the Errant Overlord will meet us on our way.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) Oh, and he is here too...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.content: (In ancient Sarkaz) Gul'dul, 'The King of Sarkaz'â€”
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traveler?

attributes.text: I couldn't know these names better. I could almost recite their legends from memory.
\nThe first line of Sarkaz I ever read was from the tale of these people, the epic transcribed time and time again, still handed down in Kazdel's slums to this day.

attributes.content: What these shadows tell of is the second Kazdel that could be called a city.
After the very first Kazdel was laid to waste by the Elders and Ancients, there passed over a thousand years where Kazdel was no more than a tiny hamlet, a mass of thatch and wooden fencing.
Frail, easily destroyed, it was ravaged by the wills of colonizers again and again, and again and again the Sarkaz were sent into exile.
Until this moment, where the Sarkaz had once again accumulated strength, once again rebuilt... a true city.
They left the wastes that we now call Columbia, and came to the heartlands of Terra, and there they lived, and there they died.
And then... a betrayal. Another migration east. And before they'd gone far, the blue flames of fury were again betrayed.
It seems as if Sarkaz history were cursed from that moment on.
History's waves have rolled on, to this present day, where citadels are incessantly scrapped and rebuilt and still amble about in arm's reach.
But the names they speak, those are that city's first Kings of Sarkaz.
The Kings of Sarkaz, seven thousand years ago.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: When did this Lich appear before us? How does she have this power?
I draw my sword, across my chest.
\nThe Lich lifts a hand.

attributes.content: Howâ€”
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: How did you produce these things?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Considering this Kazdel's historical significance and its impact on the generations to come, the legend of the Kings of Sarkaz have found such wide spread in song.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But these vagabonds? Even we lack for such trifling... er, accounts.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: This is scarcely even witchcraft... it is absolutely not. No Originium Arts could attain this degree of effect. Oh, or perhaps it could, but at the very least a historian would be needed.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Is it a trick of physics? A projector that forms images from the mist? When did our brother and sister gain such technology? How rude not to share!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Hm... no, it's off. These pictures are too close to the recorded truth. Be it a technological feat, whence came the material...?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: So this is some kind of Arts, then...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: Her hand sways gently in the air, like she's feeling something, studying the colors before her and leaving us to our devices.

attributes.content: But it's of no known category of Arts... it's highly likely, even, that it isn't Arts.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: How very strangeâ€”a Feranmut? If Victoria wanted to tame a Feranmut for battle, it should've started long ago...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: What's this bitch even doing?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It seems you are not Artists.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: You are simply and purely the ones who blew up my beloved cube. It was very comfortable sitting in it.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Messenger to the Lich's Court, Lady Ermengarde, we deeply apologize for using such a method to contact you.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I don't know what misconception you have of Liches, but honestly, I'm not that old. Stop kowtowing.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I fear this is not your Arts, either.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I certainly don't have the knack to conjure a band of seven-millennium-old vagabonds.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Hm... what if I use Arts to stimulate it? Just the most basic, tiny tiny amount, of energetic irritation...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: A squall whips up.
The vision before me recedes like the tide. The twisted scene returns to normality.
\nA bloodied boulder abruptly appears before us all.

attributes.content: What is this?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I checked this area three days ago. There was nothing like this here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Guys, we... Hey, Hoederer, W, snap out of it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: Ines is fine, thank the stars.
My blood is boiling.
